intro: Phalangium variegatum, commonly known as the variegated phalangium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It has a creeping growth habit and often forms dense mats, making it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as a drought-tolerant plant.
